website_summaries.verdict: This is a professional grade glass cutter, ideal for stained glass work that requires intricate scoring and bulk straight cutting.
pros: Metal handle also serves as oil reservoir
Intricate scoring possible with narrow blade
Designed for straight line production cutting
cons: Not ideal for thicker glass projects
Oil reservoir may not release oil, so another lubricant is required

customer_reviews.title: Clean, easy cuts !
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews here and purchased this Toyo brand and I also bought the proper cutting oil. It is an absolute night and day difference. Cuts are easier to make without too much pressure and the breaks are clean. I have gone from breaking glass to cutting glass, each and every time. This old dog has learned a new trick. The cost of this cutter is less then the broken glass I waisted on the first old cutter I am convinced so should yiou
customer_reviews.author: Burner

customer_reviews.title: Leaps and Bounds ahead of Steel Wheel Cutters
customer_reviews.text: I used to hate cutting glass for picture frames, but this cutter is a joy to use. Very easy to learn and consistent results. Some people say to use oil, some say you don't need it for this type of blade. I think it works fine without. Don't buy those cheap steel wheel cutters and just go with this from the start to save you a lot of frustration. Listen for that ripping sound to know you're putting the right pressure on the glass.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus A Larijani

customer_reviews.title: Price is high, but the quality is higher
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other cheaper glass cutters on the market, the TOYO Original Supercutter is amazing. Its quality is very fine and everything about the Supercutter is solid in design. I needed to use the cutter to score an old piece of glass and get it into a few different smaller pieces for a fixed window in a tree stand and this cutter scored the glass with ease. Sure, it's pricey, but if you want something you can depend on, then go with the TOYO Supercutter.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: CRL TOYO Original Supercutter Metal Handle
customer_reviews.text: This is the best glass cutter I have owned. Takes very little pressure to score your glass and is very well made. The hollow handle allows you to fill it with cutting oil; I use compressor oil or 3-in-1 oil. You cannot loose if you purchase this little jewel. After shopping around, I found Amazon to have the best price for this cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. D

customer_reviews.title: since one bad cut would have equaled the price of the tool
customer_reviews.text: This is the only glass cutter I've used, so I can't compare it to others. I had some fairly simple cuts to make in order to replace the glass in some outdoor lighting fixtures. Cutter worked well, even for a novice. I put a few drops of oil in the handle, as other reviewers suggested (rather than fill it), but it turned out to be easier for me to just dip the tip in oil between cuts. Likely just my lack of experience. There were less expensive cutters out there, but I thought the price was reasonable, since one bad cut would have equaled the price of the tool.
customer_reviews.author: John in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Cutter
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old Fletcher with this one, which cost a bit less than the Fletcher. Seems really well made, though I didn't have any problems with the plastic on the Fletcher I do appreciate the all metal construction of the Toyo. Too new to know how long it will work, but for the first three large panels I used it for it was very nice.
customer_reviews.author: K. Maletsky

customer_reviews.title: Worth Getting These!
customer_reviews.text: Works smooth! My husband had been buying the smaller, cheaper cutters and thought it was just his bad cutting technique. He cuts mostly window glass and some stained glass for repairs. He was pleasantly surprised, it really wasn’t him, but the equipment. Definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Devine Colts

customer_reviews.title: Great cutter, operates smoothly and cutting glass feels like ...
customer_reviews.text: Great cutter, operates smoothly and cutting glass feels like second nature with this tool. Buy this, not one of those cheap disposable ones. Now I'm saving so much money by cutting glass at home for my projects instead of paying $5-$20 to cut a pane of glass at the glass shop. This paid for itself after 2 or 3 projects.
customer_reviews.author: D. Minnis

customer_reviews.title: Quality cutter
customer_reviews.text: Toyo makes fantastic glass cutters, one thing I have noticed on almost all oil cutters I've ever used is if you're going to run long cuts you had better dip the tip. Fantastic product overall, nice weight and feel.
customer_reviews.author: Ram Horn

customer_reviews.title: Best glass cutter yet
customer_reviews.text: We tried a few other glass cutters from Lowes and Home Depot but for the thick tempered glass this thing is by far way ahead of anything you buy from your local hardware store. There is a lack of instructions but any help needed can be found on youtube.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Higby

customer_reviews.title: No oil no instructions
customer_reviews.text: One of the questions and answers to the product said it comes with oil. It had no oil and it had no instructions. Having never used a glass cutter before, have no idea where or what kind of oil to buy nor how to use it. The cutting piece that comes out of the head is about the thickness of a fingernail - is this as deep as you can cut the glass?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First time cutting glass
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to cut large oval mirrors (1/4" thick) with beveled edge from bathroom remodels square for bar mirrors. Did the job very well.
customer_reviews.author: Dado Maker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Anything I know about glass cutting from Google and youtube. I also know a quality tool makes a job much easier. This thing can be used by a child. It's super easy to cut glass with this tool. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Myles B Dyson

customer_reviews.title: No comparison to other glass cutters.
customer_reviews.text: This cutter was demonstrated to me and I was amazed. I have cut glass occasionally through the years, with mixed results. This cutter makes all the difference, Using it with the oil it is almost fool proof. If you want to cut glass and have had issues in the past, ditch that Red Devil and get a real tool that works.
customer_reviews.author: Killihoe

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome!
customer_reviews.text: It cuts nicely! It’s so much better than the ones from Home Depot, just many times better!
customer_reviews.author: AzongLee

customer_reviews.title: Finally a glass cutter that dose what you need
customer_reviews.text: Perfect works great i cut glass everyday at a frame shop. This is the only glass cutter for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Did the job!
customer_reviews.text: Cut through a 6 x 8 mirror without any issues. I highly recommend watching a few professional videos on how to use the product before attempting to use it on your mirror.
customer_reviews.author: P J

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked surprisingly well. I cut a mirror over a span of of 26 inches and it broke clean. A few of the reviews indicated that oil came with tool, but mine did not.
customer_reviews.author: Chism

customer_reviews.title: This seems to give a more consistent score line than ...
customer_reviews.text: This seems to give a more consistent score line than other cutters I have used for stained glass art. There really is a difference in quality. (If only it compensated for my lack of skill!)
customer_reviews.author: P Glauser

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This item will work well for very thin glass for stainless glass projects, but really nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: ARDANI

customer_reviews.title: Great! Better than any other glass cutter I've used, worth the money. =
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic glass cutter. Use it almost daily and haven't had any problems. Don't really need to add more oil either. I probably make 5-10 cuts a day and every once in a while I'll check and there will still be a lot of oil in there. Definitely a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Fjaxyu

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a thick old mirror and it worked great. Worth the price. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Good cutter  , best cut for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works great ,not problems If you cut glass you know a good glass cutter Nice cut sound
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY

customer_reviews.title: Good blade, but reservoir doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The oil reservoir doesn't dispense oil on the unit I received, but the carbide blade works well. I'd consider a lower-cost unit without the reservoir next time.
customer_reviews.author: Servant

customer_reviews.title: cutting mirrors
customer_reviews.text: cut glass and mirrors with ease almost no pressure needed to score glass cuts with ease. well worth paying the money for. compared to cheep ones at hardware store. if u have a lot of glass to cut buy the good one
customer_reviews.author: mickeyt

customer_reviews.title: Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for long straight cuts cutting up an old bathroom mirror. Didn't put oil in the cutter, just wiped a bead of oil going down the area, seemed to work great.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great cutter
customer_reviews.text: Looking forward to using it on my stained glass projects.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Alaskimo

customer_reviews.title: Best glass cutting tool
customer_reviews.text: This is the known best brand and product for cutting glass. This Amazon deal is an awesome price too.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Lynn

customer_reviews.title: PRO GRADE
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A VERY POPULAR GLASS CUTTER THAT THE PROFESSIONALS USE. WORKS GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: 72 Rayson Craft

customer_reviews.title: Tranforms an amateur into an expert
customer_reviews.text: Previously had bad results with another cutter. I literally wasted a huge pane of 1/4" plate glass to obtain a couple of sq. Feet. After that experience I resigned to a fate of never being able to successfully cut glass, that is until I tried with the Toyo cutter. I have made several clean cuts on 1/4" glass. No failures so far.
customer_reviews.author: Perrie Charlerie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Such a nice product. Works very well for my stained glass projects
customer_reviews.author: Quochung Ta

customer_reviews.title: No disapointment here
customer_reviews.text: Fits nicely in your hand.....nice clean scribe mark that lets the glass break cleanly.....even UV treated glass. results well worth the cost as you don't end up with pieces that haven't snapped correctly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GOOD STUFF
customer_reviews.text: GREAT GLASS CUTTER, DOES THE JOB, STILL KICKING AFTER 1 + YEAR
customer_reviews.author: Guille M

customer_reviews.title: best I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny!! Very little pressure needed, like driving a race car after driving a junker.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This thing is Soooooooo much better than the others I was using. I don't think I have to press so ridiculously hard either. You'll need to get oil, but it doesn't take much of it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Golski

customer_reviews.title: Great cutter
customer_reviews.text: Best glass cutter on market for the glazing industry in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Paul H.

customer_reviews.title: Item does not work properly
customer_reviews.text: Paid way too much for an item that does not work correctly
customer_reviews.author: Vecova

customer_reviews.title: Very easy and they came out great
customer_reviews.text: I cut a lot of windows with this tool. Very easy and they came out great.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It works very well. First time I’ve bought one so I don’t know what to compare it to but it’s doing the job I bought if for.
customer_reviews.author: Closiphone

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Works well. Nice cut. A bit pricey to me.
customer_reviews.author: Las Vegas Lady

customer_reviews.title: this cutter is hands down the best, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: this cutter is hands down the best, easy to use, don't have to use lot of force in the glass to cut ( no oil licks ) and heavy for better grip recommended all the way
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to cut out a mirror. They worked really well and I've had no problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander C. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: I was using a pistol grip cutter before and wanted to try one of these. It gives more control over where you are cutting. Very good product. Glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Roger L. Meneely

customer_reviews.title: The best cutter sold!
customer_reviews.text: There's NO reason to waste your money on any other glass cutter. This thing is the best cutter I've ever used and scores perfectly every time!
customer_reviews.author: Aeryck S. De Sade

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Used to cut a very large 1/4 mirror into five smaller pieces. Worked like a champ. Every cut scored perfectly and snapped cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: fwds

customer_reviews.title: Greattttttt
customer_reviews.text: I have not used the cutter yet. It will be use to cut stained glass. I read that this cutter is great for thick glass.
customer_reviews.author: Wilma Marina

customer_reviews.title: great cutter
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. I use kerosene as a cutting liquid and the super cutter dispenses it in a controlled manner.
customer_reviews.author: Vsmith

customer_reviews.title: comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: Item is strong, comfortable to use. the auto oiler was intermittently reliable
customer_reviews.author: Torpex

customer_reviews.title: a perfect tool!
customer_reviews.text: The glass cutter works like a charm--could not be more pleased to have this tool. I highly reccommend it. thanks
customer_reviews.author: F. Sharpy

customer_reviews.title: Nice cutter.
customer_reviews.text: This is quality like I have never seen before. Great buy for stain glass work.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel N Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to cut about 100 wine bottles at the neck for center pieces at a wedding. Worked perfectly. This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is a whole lot better than yhe five dollars special from H.D. scores glass like butter without the pressure you have to apply with the cheaper one. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D.

customer_reviews.title: Great cutter!
customer_reviews.text: Great glass cutter, I use this tool constantly at work.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Hass

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I needed this a long long time ago! Works flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: New at it
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I can cut glass now, but this little tool did the job. Antique mirror backsplash
customer_reviews.author: Dolly Burton

customer_reviews.title: pricey,, but worth evry penny !!
customer_reviews.text: I am no professional,, but the last time I cut glass at home,, it was with one of the cheaper ones from a hardware store. This one cuts glass like it is butter !! I even veered off my straightedge once while practicing,, and it left a sharp line, and when I set it over the edge of the workbench,, I had a wavy piece of glass !! It does not take a whole lot of pressure to score the glass either ! I am very impressed !!
customer_reviews.author: Allan C. McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: best glass cutter
customer_reviews.text: this cutter has the TC-17 cutting head witch is the best makes glass cutting easy and fast .
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lesny

customer_reviews.title: First quality at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly from the beginning. I am not experienced at glass cutting, but have to engage in the practice occasionally. Previously my experience with a German cutter had been frustrating, and my success was erratic at best. From the very first time I used the Toyo Supercutter I was successful –the tool works flawlessly. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Antonio Arce Arenales

customer_reviews.title: Used the old buy the best so you don't regret
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with this cutter. Used the old buy the best so you don't regret. Worked out so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Thomas

customer_reviews.title: use lube
customer_reviews.text: sharp. cut window arches in wave glass well. single strength just falls apart under it . have some 3/8" to try next. going to convert an old table top.
customer_reviews.author: Peter B.

customer_reviews.title: good product!!
customer_reviews.text: good quality, as espected, first time I can cut glass without any problem!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Julio R.

customer_reviews.title: Best cutter
customer_reviews.text: The best I've used ! Scores the glass / mirrior every time 😜
customer_reviews.author: Frederick A. Thorn

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Feels good in the hand- does what it needs to do. I haven't used the 'oil handle' yet- rather i just keep it in a semi-sealed cup with a soaked pad of oil so it doesn't rust.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Supercutter
customer_reviews.text: This one worked great for me, used to re size bathroom vanity mirrors 1/4" thk. Did not use the oil reservoir, just used light oil from oil can. Surprised that I didn't have to scrap any mirror pieces cut as I hadn't done this before.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Skip the cheapos and get this
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a few other glass cutters with pretty bad results. I decided to bite the bullet and give this one a try even though it was much pricier than others. Works great. I am finally able to cut glass rings from wine bottles. I still have a few cuts go astray but my success rate has sky rocketed with this cutter!
customer_reviews.author: Sonja G

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent cutter. It requires little to no pressure to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent cutter. It requires little to no pressure to score glass. I used light weight household oil and it dispensed that oil just fine during the cut.
customer_reviews.author: Home Remodeler

customer_reviews.title: Not for extremely precise scribing
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice cutter but didn't work for my specific need. The carbide wheel has some play so if you need to make very thin and very straight scribe lines, this won't work. Get a diamond or carbide tipped scribe instead.
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: A professional tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is truly the Staff of God!!! I've never had better experience in glass cutting. You definitely want one if you play with glass heavily.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wang

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Did not cut 3/8 glass like they said it would
customer_reviews.author: RAUL YANEZ

customer_reviews.title: No hex nut on oil resivor
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a Toyo cutter this is one, But it doesn't come with the hex nut top to the oil reservoir!!!
customer_reviews.author: ERIC

customer_reviews.title: Really expensive for a glass cutter! Just go to ...
customer_reviews.text: Really expensive for a glass cutter! Just go to Lowe's or Home Depot. Oh and this cutter does not work on thicker glass!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kennedy

product_meta.title: CRL TOYO Original Supercutter Metal Handle Straight Head Oil Cutter by CR Laurence
product_meta.description: The Toyo Oil Cutter is among the best in the industry. Known for its long wheel life, this cutter was built to last, and make the cleanest scores in glass cutting today. An automatic oil dispensing system keeps the wheel lubricated every time you cut. The brass handle acts as a reservoir and designed for longevity. Wheel angle is 134°. This cutter fits conveniently in your pouch for use around the shop or in the field.
feature_bullets: Traditional Straight Handle Oil Cutter with Straight Cutting Head

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars204 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
